section.heading: Standard of review of appellate court.

content.p: 59-1-610. Standard of review of appellate court. (1) When reviewing formal adjudicative proceedings commenced before the commission, the Court of Appeals or Supreme Court shall: (a) grant the commission deference concerning its written findings of fact, applying a substantial evidence standard on review; and (b) grant the commission no deference concerning its conclusions of law, applying a correction of error standard, unless there is an explicit grant of discretion contained in a statute at issue before the appellate court. (2) This section supercedes Section 63G-4-403 pertaining to judicial review of formal adjudicative proceedings. Amended by Chapter 382 , 2008 General Session
